runs.comm: drifts to leg, helped fine with a wristy flick, and it's four all the way
full outside off, he tries a drive but gets a thick inside edge into his pad, the ball rolls to Edwards
back of a length, turned off his hips into the leg side, Simmons trots across to field
super delivery, outside off, Davies half fences and he is well beaten
overpitched and driven through cover, Simmons chases, dives, but can only follow the ball into the boundary marker
he steps to leg and tries a wild flay through the off side, he moved too far and left himself with far too much to reach the ball which was outside off
on his toes and steered to deep backward point
driven with minimal footwork, it squirts slightly behind square and there's two to Chanderpaul in the deep
lovely shot, stands tall and punches through the covers, the same place as his first boundary but this time he really middled it
a shimmy to the off, works the ball with an open face to Chanderpaul at third man
expansive drive, a thick bottom edge to a slower one and Ramdin makes a tumbling stop to his right
pushed defensively to mid-on and a scrambled single, quick off the mark and there was nothing the close men could do
whipped off middle and leg, all wrists and timing, through midwicket and the fielders were never going to overtake it
thick edge, along the ground to Sarwan who dives to his right at first slip
defensive push back to Edwards who makes  a sluggish attempt to field and that allows the single and mid-off has to scamper round
across his stumps again, but Davies can only defend as Edwards follows him
slower and fuller, rasping drive straight at Sammy at shortish extra cover, he did well to get his body behind it but the rebound allowed the single
again Bopara whips the ball of his toes to deep backward square leg, but Ramdin has sussed that shot and plugged the gap
his middle stump goes cartwheeling as Bopara takes a step down the track and looks to give himself some room to smack the ball over the off-side cordon ... and misses
full and accurate, slightly tucked up and he has to defend
swished off his pads to deep midwicket, quickly picked up by Bravo and he prevents the second
across and driven square on the off side but he can't find the gap
this time he squeezes it finer, opening the face more, and Chanderpaul fields at third man
he dances down the pitch, gets a thick leading edge into the off side, takes the single and would have easily beaten Pollard's throw even if it had hit
slower, he spots it but too late to play an attacking shot and he pushes gently back to the bowler
he positively charges towards the bowler, takes it on the pad and Sammy is quick to pick up in his follow through
they won't love that, Sammy drifts to leg and Pietersen's glance beats the man saving one on the 45
checked shot through square leg, they take on the arm for the second and win ... Simmons hesitated before sending in his return and his captain is very unimpressed
driven hard to mid-off who is on the edge of the circle
an ugly heave, he misses, the rebound off his pads squirts into the off side and he beats the shy at the stumps
drives a square drive outside off and is beaten
no cheers for that one, short and Davies pulls it over wide midwicket
steps to leg and slashes the ball first bounce to Chanderpaul at third man
short and down leg - 83mph - and the umpire isn't fooled by Ramdin's appeal as Pietersen's swish misses
another short one, pulled without conviction to backward square leg
turned off leg stump to short fine leg, Edwards fields
half volley swung over wide midwicket, Pollard chases and skids as if on ice over the boundary ... more through it ... but the ball was always ahead of him
swept on the full ... paddled more round to fine leg
slashing drive to deep extra cover, a fumbled pick up from Sammy but the return is good
turns into Davies and he is too cramped to do much with it
almost yorks himself, but a thick edge squirts past the keeper and four all the way
again beaten, this time saved by his pad as he swishes to leg
fullish, flicked off his toes to the man deep in the square
bowled round his legs, but he moved so far across that it was his offstump he lost as he swung into the on side
lovely slower ball, Shah checks, and Bravo speeds up in his follow through to field
back and defended
beaten as he swishes to leg, taken on the pad, Bravo appeals but nobody else interested
a bouncer that really takes off, Shah ducks, Ramdin leaps but it's too high for him and that's four ... wides to add to the insult
clipped wide of a diving Sarwan at short midwicket, long-on mops up
heaved into the on side and an easy single to midwicket
undone with knobs on ... outside off and Pietersen looks a novice as he swings and misses
single to Pollard at long-on
driven up the ground
flicked off his toes to deep backward square leg
extravagant off drive, low and head over the ball, deep cover fields

looks to force into the on side and is hit on the pad, Benn roars an appeal and after a long delay umpire Norman Malcolm gives him ... Pietersen moved a long way across his stumps and he can't have much complaint about that
driven back at the non striker, mid-on has to move to his left and that allows the single
driven to Bravo's right, he drops a hand down with agility to prevent the run and the crowd love that
pushed into the off side, they take on Sammy, a great pick-up and throw would have left Collingwood waiting on the third umpire
languid drive back to Bravo on the bounce
shorter and quicker, dropped into the leg side off his thigh pad
worked with wristwork over midwicket from outside off, the kind of shot that would have been roundly condemned a generation ago but which is so much a part of the game now
back and pushed into the off side and again the throw would have left Shah short ... Bravo did everything right except hit
full toss placed to deep midwicket, Simmons' throw stops the second
speared down the leg side, beats batsman as he tries to sweep and keeper and that's four wides
wild drive, a thick inside edge to short fine leg and Edwards can't prevent the run
clipped to deepish midwicket
faster and flatter, Shah tries to drive over long-on but Pollard, a yard inside the rope, takes it with ease at head height
that looked close, a limp push which beats the bat, he was only half forward, and the leg bye results as the ball dribbles into the off side while Benn again bellows an appeal
reaches to drive, a thickish edge to third man
short, Collingwood on his toes, drops the ball into the off side and Sammy overruns the ball as he races in
down leg and Strauss almost sniffily allows it to pass without playing at it
down the pitch, pushes into off side between point and cover
turned off his hips, Chanderpaul at fine leg fields
a step to off and flicked behind square on the leg side, Edwards trots in from the boundary edge to field
full toss well outside leg stump, Collingwood quick to help it on its way to fine leg ... with the man up on the 45 that was four all the way
slower ball, defended, but Sammy quick to field to his left
a big, booming leading edge towards long-off, it bounces on the 30-yard fielding line and so is quite safe
full toss driven hard to long-off where Bravo fields
fluent cover drive to Simmons who is sweeping

swing to leg from outside off stump, Collingwood hits that miles in the air ... Simmons moves into position ten yards inside the midwicket boundary and has to wait an eternity before pouching it, to roars from the packed stands
slower ball, Strauss waits and steers very deliberately to third man
back and cuts but into the ground and Sammy fields with ease
Strauss steps out to meet it but cramps himself and he can only pat the ball back to the bowler
outside off, a swing to leg and a miss
two steps and driven hard to long-off
back and a slightly rushed push towards mid-off but Pollard steps across to gather it
turned to wide midwicket, again too cramped to do much more
driven on the bounce to Sammy ... roars as some of the crowd think that's a return catch
opens the face and runs down to third man

daft running and, as far as England are concerned, the wrong man has been run-out. Mascarenhas pushed square on the off side, started for the run, checked, and from then on it was going to end in tears ... Mascarenhas was not even in the frame as the ball was returned to Sammy
slower and placed towards backward point
full and on off stump, jabbed drive to mid-on
driven on the walk to midwicket where Chanderpaul fields on the edge of the circle
driven between mid-on and midwicket, that placing allows the second
swept from outside off, well hit and fine enough to beat the field
driven hard into the ground and Pollard fields on the bounce
steps to off and shapes to flip the ball fine with a paddle-stroke, Pollard delivers the ideal ball and Strauss gets another four
driven hard to extra cover, a great pick-up and throw from Fletcher and Batty would have gone had he hit
ugly kind of pull into the on side
slow and wide, Strauss leaves and looks a bit miffed that no wide was called
heaved into the on side
back and dropped two yards into the off side, Strauss is through for the run and Batty, after hesitating responds ... no alarms though
super slower ball outside off, ultra slow, and Strauss is left swinging at thin air

hard drive to Chanderpaul at midwicket, the pick-up and throw is excellent, Sammy has to gather and whip the bails off and it's referred to the third umpire ...it's close ... were the bails off? Viv Richards calls it not out ... but TV umpire Clancy Mack from Antigua finally gives him out. The crowd loves it, Strauss less impressed, but he's on his way ...
turned into the leg side
short and fast, hurriedly turned off his thigh to deep square leg
back and patted to mid-off
driven hard into the ground and to Pollard at point
a horrible cross-batted heave, he misses and the ball passes over the stumps

brilliant fielding, as has been the case all afternoon   ... Batty hit the ball straight to Sarwan at extra cover, he picked up and threw down the bowler's-end stumps on the bounce, Batty just kept running all the way to the boundary
hit to extra cover ... it doesn't quite carry to a tumbling Benn
full toss turned into the leg side
misses as he tries to sweep off his stumps ... loud shout but nothing doing
back and defended to the bowler
driven on the half-volley to deepish mid-on
worked off his legs to deep midwicket, Khan wants a second but Broad's had enough of run-outs and sends him back
attempts to drive through the covers but plays down completely the wrong line and the ball takes his off stump
driven on the half volley, he reaches for it, and an easy catch for Benn at cover
